# OpenHack MDWH - Azure Synapse Analytics Demo
## Challenge 4 - More than meets the eye - Streaming Data

### Azure Synapse Analytics Demo
https://github.com/aessing/demo-azuresynapse

### Developer
Andre Essing</br>
https://www.andre-essing.de/</br>
https://github.com/aessing</br>
https://twitter.com/aessing</br>
https://www.linkedin.com/in/aessing/

> THIS CODE AND INFORMATION ARE PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND,
> EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE IMPLIED
> WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND/OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.

## Set some parameters

Can be overriden by Azure Synapse Pipelines
## Import some libraries and build some functions for internal use

from pyspark.sql.types import StringType, TimestampType, IntegerType
from pyspark.sql.functions import concat, col, lit, udf, upper
import uuid
#### Read data from lake - Southridge Transactions

df_Southridge = ( spark.read.load('abfss://movies@demosynapsedls01.dfs.core.windows.net/raw/Southridge/CloudStreaming/dbo.Transactions.parquet',
                        format='parquet',
                        inferSchema=True,
                        header=True, 
                        ignoreLeadingWhiteSpace=True, 
                        ignoreTrailingWhiteSpace=True
                        ))

display(df_Southridge, summary=True)

# Add columns
df_SouthridgeModified = (
    df_Southridge.withColumn("SourceID", lit("1").cast(IntegerType()))
            .withColumn("UniqueOrderID", concat(col('SourceID'), col('TransactionID')).cast(StringType()))
            .withColumn("UniqueMovieID", concat(col('SourceID'), col('MovieID')).cast(StringType()))
            .withColumn("UniqueCustomerID", concat(col('SourceID'), col('CustomerID')).cast(StringType()))
#           .withColumn("GlobalTransactionID", uuidUDF())

)

# Reorder colums
df_SouthridgeModified = df_SouthridgeModified.select(
    'SourceID',
    'UniqueOrderID',
    'TransactionID',
    'UniqueMovieID',
    'MovieID',
    'CustomerID',
    'UniqueCustomerID',
    'StreamStart',
    'StreamEnd',
)

# Convert column types
df_SouthridgeModified = (
    df_SouthridgeModified.withColumn("SourceID", col("SourceID").cast(IntegerType()))
                           .withColumn("UniqueOrderID", upper(col("UniqueOrderID").cast(StringType())))
                           .withColumn("TransactionID", upper(col("TransactionID").cast(StringType())))
                           .withColumn("UniqueMovieID", upper(col("UniqueMovieID").cast(StringType())))
                           .withColumn("MovieID", upper(col("MovieID").cast(StringType())))
                           .withColumn("CustomerID", upper(col("CustomerID").cast(StringType())))
                           .withColumn("UniqueCustomerID", upper(col("UniqueCustomerID").cast(StringType())))
                           .withColumn("StreamStart", col("StreamStart").cast(TimestampType()))
                           .withColumn("StreamEnd", col("StreamEnd").cast(TimestampType()))
)

display(df_SouthridgeModified, summary=True)
## Writed curated data back to the data lake
